content:
ForeignKeyConstraint Class

Definition

Represents an action restriction enforced on a set of columns in a primary key/foreign key relationship when a value or row is either deleted or updated.

In this Article

[ECMA2Yaml.Models.ECMAAttribute]
[ECMA2Yaml.Models.ECMAAttribute]
public class ForeignKeyConstraint : System.Data.Constraint
Inheritance
Object
Constraint
ForeignKeyConstraint
Attributes
DefaultPropertyAttribute EditorAttribute

Inherited Members

_DataSet
CheckStateForProperty()
ConstraintName
ExtendedProperties
SetDataSet(DataSet)
ToString()
Equals(Object, Object)
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object, Object)

Examples

The following example creates a ForeignKeyConstraint, sets some of its properties, and adds it to a DataTable object's ConstraintCollection. 

' The next line goes into the Declarations section of the module:
' SuppliersProducts is a class derived from DataSet.
Private suppliersProducts As SuppliersProducts

Private Sub CreateConstraint()
    ' Declare parent column and child column variables.
    Dim parentColumn As DataColumn
    Dim childColumn As DataColumn
    Dim fkeyConstraint As ForeignKeyConstraint

    ' Set parent and child column variables.
    parentColumn = suppliersProducts.Tables("Suppliers").Columns("SupplierID")
    childColumn = suppliersProducts.Tables("Products").Columns("SupplierID")
    fkeyConstraint = New ForeignKeyConstraint( _
        "SupplierFKConstraint", parentColumn, childColumn)

    ' Set null values when a value is deleted.
    fkeyConstraint.DeleteRule = Rule.SetNull
    fkeyConstraint.UpdateRule = Rule.Cascade
    fkeyConstraint.AcceptRejectRule = AcceptRejectRule.Cascade

    ' Add the constraint, and set EnforceConstraints to true.
    suppliersProducts.Tables("Products").Constraints.Add(fkeyConstraint)
    suppliersProducts.EnforceConstraints = True
End Sub

Remarks

A ForeignKeyConstraint restricts the action performed when a value in a column (or columns) is either deleted or updated. Such a constraint is intended to be used with primary key columns. In a parent/child relationship between two tables, deleting a value from the parent table can affect the child rows in one of the following ways.

  • The child rows can also be deleted (a cascading action).

  • The values in the child column (or columns) can be set to null values.

  • The values in the child column (or columns) can be set to default values.

  • An exception can be generated.

ForeignKeyConstraint objects are contained in the ConstraintCollection of a DataTable, which is accessed through the Constraints property.

Constraints are not enforced unless the EnforceConstraints property is set to true.

The AcceptRejectRule is enforced whenever a DataTable object's AcceptChanges method is invoked.

ForeignKeyConstraint(String, String, String[], String[], AcceptRejectRule, Rule, Rule)

This constructor is provided for design time support in the Visual Studio environment. ForeignKeyConstraint objects created by using this constructor must then be added to the collection via stem.Data.ConstraintCollection.AddRange*. Tables and columns with the specified names must exist at the time the method is called, or if stem.Data.DataTable.BeginInit* has been called prior to calling this constructor, the tables and columns with the specified names must exist at the time that stem.Data.DataTable.EndInit* is called.

public ForeignKeyConstraint (string constraintName, string parentTableName, string[] parentColumnNames, string[] childColumnNames, System.Data.AcceptRejectRule acceptRejectRule, System.Data.Rule deleteRule, System.Data.Rule updateRule);

One of the Rule values to use when a row is deleted. The default is Cascade. Possible values include: None, Cascade, SetNull, SetDefault, and Default.

One of the Rule values to use when a row is updated. The default is Cascade. Possible values include: None, Cascade, SetNull, SetDefault, and Default.

Properties

AcceptRejectRule

Indicates the action that should take place across this constraint when stem.Data.DataTable.AcceptChanges* is invoked.

public virtual System.Data.AcceptRejectRule AcceptRejectRule { get; set; }
Value
AcceptRejectRule

One of the AcceptRejectRule values. Possible values include None, and Cascade. The default is None.

Attributes
DefaultValueAttribute

Remarks

Changes to a DataRow or DataTable are not final until the AcceptChanges method is invoked. At that point, the AcceptRejectRule determines the course of action on any values that have been changed or deleted.

Columns

Gets the child columns of this constraint.

public virtual System.Data.DataColumn[] Columns { get; }
Value
DataColumn[]

An array of DataColumn objects that are the child columns of the constraint.

Attributes
ReadOnlyAttribute

DeleteRule

Gets or sets the action that occurs across this constraint when a row is deleted.

public virtual System.Data.Rule DeleteRule { get; set; }
Value
Rule

One of the Rule values. The default is Cascade.

Attributes
DefaultValueAttribute

Remarks

When a row is deleted from a parent table, the DeleteRule determines what will happen in the columns of the child table (or tables). If the rule is set to Cascade, child rows will be deleted.

If set to SetNull, a DBnull will be placed in the appropriate columns of the affected rows. Depending on your data source, a null value may or may not be permitted in a column. For example, SQLServer allows multiple null values to be found in a primary key column, even if they are not unique. In a DataTable, however, if a DataColumn object's Unique property is set to true, multiple null values are not allowed in primary key columns.

If set to SetDefault, the default value for the column is assigned.

RelatedColumns

The parent columns of this constraint.

public virtual System.Data.DataColumn[] RelatedColumns { get; }
Value
DataColumn[]

An array of DataColumn objects that are the parent columns of the constraint.

ReadOnlyAttribute

Gets or sets the action that occurs across this constraint on when a row is updated.

public virtual System.Data.Rule UpdateRule { get; set; }
Value
Rule

One of the Rule values. The default is Cascade.

This type is safe for multithreaded read operations. You must synchronize any write operations.
